name: JW Marriott Marquis Miami

reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.title: Best quality-cost 5-star hotel!
Best "group" property in the Brickell Area
reviews.text: Brickell, the financial district of Miami has 30+ hotels in a 4 block radius. If you consider the big 5 chains (SPG, Marriott, Hilton, Intercontinental, Hyatt), the JW Marriott Marquis is the best property in the area. Please note that there is another JW Marriott in this area which is not where you want to be.

Walking into the lobby area, you are welcomed by this really massive lobby which sets the perfect tone for this hotel - EVERYTHING IS BIG - the rooms, TV, bathrooms, bath tubs, shower areas, concierge lounge, the hearts of the people who work here -
reviews.title: One of the nicesst US hotels I've been at

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel in downtown Miami. The room was large, and well set up with a large desk, very fast and reliable internet. The large TV and the TV in the bathroom were nice features I guess but I didn't really use them. The gym pool and fitness facilities were great.

Just across the road is a cool old bar (oldest in Miami I am told) called the Tobacco Bar. Not a glitzy South Beach place but a fun, comfortable place in downtown.

reviews.title: A Vacation before the vacation !

reviews.text: Apparently, this is Marriott's top hotel branded as the Marquis. It feels like I am staying in a foreign country or on a cruise ship since none of the staff speak English well or some don't at all; which makes it difficult to answer questions. Maybe it's just Miami since no one here speaks English well. Yes if you are from Miami, your mumbling English is horrid. This is a clean modern hotel geared towards business travelers. They have one of the best fitness centers for a hotel; the pool is nice also. They use TechnoGym equipment which I like. The rooms are set up with a nice desk which already as a desktop computer for Internet use. A nice 55" flat screen with HD channels in the room. This hotel is comparable, but just a step away, to the Ritz Carlton that Marriott Group owns. This is not a family friendly hotel for kids which I like as a business traveler.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Service

reviews.text: Wow ! Cannot say enough good things about this hotel..not only was it gorgeous...comfortable bed...clean....awesome 55 in TV.......computer in room ...tv in the BR !!!! The staff in the concierge lounge was OUTSTANDING ! We stayed here for 2 nites before a cruise and as this title states.....staying here was truly like a mini vacation ! NICEST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED AT !!!

description: The JW Marriott Marquis Miami is situated in Miami’s new Metropolitan Miami development. The first-to-market JW Marriott property boasts 313 guestrooms, inclusive of 56 suites, along with a broad array of amenities, including renowned chef-restaurateur, Daniel Boulud’s db Bistro Moderne. Offering a diverse setting for business, meeting and pleasure travel pursuits, the 41-story hotel features three concierge levels; 80,000-square-feet of total function space including a 20,000 sq. ft. Grand Ballroom; and one of the most unique indoor sports, lifestyle and entertainment complexes of any hotel in the U.S. The 50,000-square-foot, two-story indoor facility includes a NBA-approved basketball arena, tennis court, Jim McLean Golf School, virtual bowling alley, billiards, full-service Rik Rak Salon & Spa and more. Owned and operated by Met 2 Hotels LLC, the JW Marriott Marquis Miami is located at 255 Biscayne Blvd. Way, Miami, FL.
